alert.note: Alert for Park (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 09 at 11:28AM MST by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...Park County about 12 miles southwest of Cody. The minor flooding caused by an ice jam is impacting areas from the 6Qs road Bridge near StageTrail road, south to just north of the junction of the 6Qs road and Southfork road. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Thursday Mar 16. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas along the South Fork of the Shoshone River in the areas mentioned above. The river gauge just south of the 6Qs road Bridge near Stagecoach Trail road will fluctuate between 7.5 feet and 9.5 feet over the next several days. Flood stage at this site is 9.5 feet, but minor flooding can occur between 8.5 feet and 9.5 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1119 AM MST, gauge, emergency management, and trained spotter reports indicated an ice jam near the advisory area. - The river will be at the highest levels between 5 PM and 5 AM each day. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
